snippet: Marion S. Barry Jr. is trying to be remembered for more than the night in 1990 when he was caught on tape smoking crack cocaine.
abstract: Marion S Barry Jr, infamous former mayor of Washington and now city councilman in the District of Columbia, describes in his autobiography Mayor for Life his rise to power and his forays into drug use; is trying to be remembered for more than the night in 1990 when he was caught on camera smoking crack cocaine in a hotel.
lead_paragraph: Marion S. Barry Jr. is trying to be remembered for more than the night in 1990 when he was caught on tape smoking crack cocaine.

headline.main: Barry, Once Washington’s ‘Mayor for Life,’ Tries to Shape Legacy With Autobiography
headline.print_headline: Scandal-Plagued ‘Mayor for Life’ Aims to Shape Legacy in New Book
